results.title: Love My Way: Stick Sisters
results.creator_credit: Ian Watson, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 5 first aired on Foxtel on 13th December 2004.

group_siblings.title: Love My Way: What's In a Name
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Tony McNamara

results.title: Love My Way: A Different Planet
results.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 8 first aired on Foxtel on 17th January 2005.

results.title: Crash Zone: No News is Good News
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
The kids are alone at Catalyst and having a great time when Kimberley arrives. She’s a news reporter, there to do a story on the testers. Mike is flattered but the other kids begin to suspect she’s a spy. Pi finally succeeds in getting rid of Kimberley only to find her own mother has tracked her to Catalyst. Pi’s unmasked. Now everybody knows she’s a rich kid.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Undercover
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Alex’s valuable necklace goes missing at Catalyst and everyone is a suspect. Pi feels particularly that she needs to prove her innocence although Virgil’s idea of helping by downloading Detective Stories from the Net is making things more difficult. When Marcello’s little sister Sam is lost on the streets, the kids have two demanding cases on their hands.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Dream Team
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
A coded message on the Net becomes an irresistible puzzle for Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram. Following the clues leads them to a meeting with Alexandra Davis, head of Software company Catalyst, and a job testing video games after school! The job of their dreams which brings unexpected surprises including the discovery of Virgil, a strange artificial intelligence loose on the Net.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
